result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Bownds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days; alternate 12 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K Bownds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Justin Singleton in court.   Defendant Brian K Bownds did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Ct. 2 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered. Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following:
- Fine totaling $393.50 to be paid within 60 days; alternate 60 days jail
Jury trial - 12 person on August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian K Bownds in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense does not have this case resolved and is requesting a jury status/jury trial date. Court grants request.  Form given to Attorney regarding motions, jury instructions and witnesses.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian K Bownds in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense needs to meet with ADA Nickolie to try to resolve this matter and if not resolved it will go to trial. Court will give another date.  Hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian K Bownds in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense received discovery. Defense requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witnesses or the business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Brian K Bownds in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
